intro: Desmostachys acuminatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in composite flower heads. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, this species is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and a subject of ecological study.
